subject: Web3
title: Phishing Attacks on NFT Holders
description: A quick win: understand Phishing Attacks on NFT Holders.

hook.text: Hackers stole millions in NFTs by tricking owners into signing a single transaction. One click, everything gone.

buildup.text: Phishing links disguised as marketplace emails or Discord messages led users to fake approval screens.

discovery.text: Signing a malicious transaction gave the attacker permission to transfer all NFTs from the victim's wallet.

twist.text: The transactions were irreversible. No customer support, no chargebacks, no way to undo the theft.

climax.text: Self-custody means self-responsibility. Without a bank, there's no one to call when things go wrong.

punchline.text: One bad click can empty your entire wallet. No undo button.

quiz.question: How do NFT phishing attacks typically work?
options: Tricking users into signing malicious transactions
